alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 03 at 4:39AM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two to three inches. * WHERE...Portions of the Panhandle of Oklahoma. portions of the Panhandle of Texas. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon CST today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
